climbs.name: Standard Route
climbs.fa: See Greg Collins and Vance White's "Lander Rock" book.

content.description: This route follows the crack to the base of the huge overhanging rock at the top of the cliff, at the OH go left. No harder than 5.5
content.protection: very light rack up to #3 friend
content.location:
At Hwy 287 parking area you will see a mass of granite, walk north East (41 degrees) 1.6 miles, cross river, head NW (336 degrees true) 0.5 mile to base.

Photo shows a large over hanging rock at the top of the cliff, below and to the left is a shield of granite, climb the right side of the shield.

GPS location is near base

137	8/20/2006 11:14:29 AM 	6315 ft			6 ft	00:00:12	0.37 mph	73° true	N42 28.550 W107 31.889

climbs.name: The Overload
climbs.fa: Mal Miller, Greg Collins, Dan Heilig

content.description:
Split Rock, South Face, right side slab. Right of Prometheus Unchained (5.10- G 4 pitches**) and left of Fire and Sage (5.9 G 5 pitches ***) Overload is the center of the purest slab, the last pitch water groove, black streak is an obvious feature. A trad slab with runouts. The X grade is on the 5.6 2nd pitch. The first and last crux pitches are R grade.

Lander Rock 2005 Collins/White has all the routes on Split Rock South Face
content.protection: Hand drilled on free lead bolts. Poor protection.
content.location: Split Rock, South Face, right side slab. Walk and scramble off right, east.

content.description: Right of Standard Route is a featured slab with clean, solid rock exfoliations and slabs. An early, traditionally protected slab on Split Rocks Main SE Face. A great route to refine trad skills, route finding, adventuring. Once a very popular right of passage for NOLS Instructors.
content.protection: No fix. Full trad, including building anchors. You will need 1&1/2 sets mostly thin and sling. With this rack it is possible to finish the last pitch with "Blow Out" 5.10b ** hand crack on the overhanging summit block.
content.location: 20m right of Standard Route. Locate red colored spot of rock and quest straight up slab with small gear and slings in thin cracks and under overlaps. Belay 3 times on nice ledges.

climbs.name: High Plains Saga
climbs.fa: Tony Jewell, Dan Heilig, Mal Miller

content.description: Big ole, clean slab, a little older than Fire and Sage II 5.8 to it’s right, and the same age as Prometheus Unchained II 5.9+ to it’s left. Four pitches with the crux right away on pitch 1. Then, mostly interesting, easier slab above, consult topo in photos.
This is a 5 pitch, user friendly, slab and face route on the felsic veined, Granite Face in the right side of Split Rock SE Face.
content.location: Right side Split Rock SE Face, see photo of topo in Splitrock.

content.description: Similar to Joshua Tree’s mini-crack route, Central Scrutinizer, Lentil Scrutinizer is Split Rocks more obscure version. A tiny, savage, west facing crack rig, 150m north of the sage brush line in a gulley 150 m SE of the ‘Overload’ Slab.
content.protection: Tips to fingers, or pads, or top rope
content.location: Below ‘Overload’ slab, 150m SE of Fire and Sage, 200m N of Sweetwater River on a small, very clean, short overhanging  west facing micro crag.
